_header: Holy Writ sayeth which no thing is soother
Subjects: carols, of religious counsel; counsel, religious
_description: ‘Amende me and peyre me nauȝt’ — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘I pray yow all wyth o thowght / Amende me and peyre me nowght’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Holy wryt sayth no thyng is sotherþat no man shuld a peyre
                    oþer…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…And in hevyn to se hys facewher al thyng a mend & peyer
                    novȝth
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 29-30.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 278.

BodArcSelB26.First Lines:
Holy Wryt seyȝt Whech no thyng ys sotherþat [ ] schuld
                    þeyre other…
BodArcSelB26.Last Lines:
…In heuyn to se his glorious faceWher we shull amend &
                    peyr nougth
BodArcSelB26.Note: Damaged by water, with some loss of text.

BLAdd5665.First Lines:
Holy wryt seyght whech nothyng ys sotherThat no man shuld apeyre
                    other…
BLAdd5665.Last Lines:
…In hevyn to se his glorious faceWher we schull amend &
                    pryr nougth

BLEge3307.First Lines:
Holy wret seþ noþing ys sotherþat no man schuld
                    apeir other…
BLEge3307.Last Lines:
…In heuen þer to se hys faceqwer we schall mend &
                    peyr nogh
